main event: On February 13, 1953, three bright lights were observed traveling at high speeds over Fort Worth, Texas, with radar detections also noted.
interesting points: Visual observation by a civilian showed the lights arranged in vertical echelon and maneuvering rapidly,The lights accelerated from 500 feet apart to 20,000 feet in altitude within moments,The sighting lasted for 10-15 seconds before the lights disappeared,Intermittent radar detection of the lights was noted,Two of the three lights were successfully picked up on radar, but one was lost in noise.
sighted object: three bright lights in the sky
witness description: Mr. [REDACTED] and three other members of Department 76 at Convair observed the incident.
